word:
I thank you both for writing. I have had much writing to do of late. And, as I consider the matter, I realize that it is a very, very long "of late." I feel deeply interested in your work in New York City, and have often desired that it were possible for me to step before your assemblies and bear my testimony.--Letter 185, 1903, p. 1. (To Elder and Mrs. S. N. Haskell, August 17, 1903.) 


                                    -301-
